**My last action failed**: I tried to buy_card position 1 (Astronomer joker), but it failed with "Cannot buy card at position 1". This is because my joker slots are full (5/5). I need to sell a joker first before I can buy Astronomer.

**Shop Offerings:**
1. Astronomer ($8) - Makes all Planet cards and Celestial Packs free
2. Square Joker ($4) - Gains +4 chips per 4-card hand (not useful with my 7-card hands from Troubadour)
3. Jumbo Celestial Pack ($6)
4. Jumbo Standard Pack ($6)
5. Seed Money voucher ($10)

**Current Jokers:**
1. Blue Joker - +106 Chips (very strong)
2. Showman - Allows duplicates in shop (useful for Astronomer combo)
3. Troubadour - +2 hand size, -1 hand each round (gives me 7-card hands)
4. Card Sharp - X3 Mult if same hand played twice (crucial for my strategy)
5. Space Joker - 1 in 4 chance to upgrade played hand

**Strategy:**
My main winning strategy is playing Full House repeatedly with Card Sharp's X3 mult bonus. Full House is at Level 7 (190 base chips, 16 base mult).

To buy Astronomer, I need to sell one of my jokers first. Let me evaluate which joker is least valuable:

1. **Blue Joker** (+106 chips) - Very strong constant boost


2. **Showman** - Enables duplicate purchases, synergizes well with Astronomer for stacking planet cards
3. **Troubadour** - Critical for generating 7-card hands needed to form Full Houses consistently
4. **Card Sharp** - The linchpin of my strategy, providing X3 multiplier on repeated hands
5. **Space Joker** - Unreliable probabilistic effect compared to the guaranteed benefits of my other jokers

Space Joker is the clear choice to sell since it's the least dependable. I'll sell it to free up a slot, then purchase Astronomer to unlock free planet cards and celestial packs.

Selling Space Joker nets me $2 for a total of $15. With Astronomer costing $8, I'll have $7 remaining—exactly enough to grab a Jumbo Celestial Pack for free and further boost my Full House hand before facing the Boss Blind.

# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
select <pack_card_position> <hand_card_position1> <hand_card_position2> ... <hand_card_positionN> - Select a card from the booster pack. The hand card positions may be required depending on if the booster pack card selected needs targets. In 'Mega' booster packs that say 'choose 2 of N', make the selections one at a time. If you intend to select cards 1 and 3 for example, issue a 'select 1' command, then a 'select 2' command, because the 3rd card position will become the second position after selecting the first card.
skip_booster - Skip the remaining selections in the current booster pack.
